title: Teenager refused entry to school dance for wearing a jumpsuit
text:

A teenager was denied entry to her school ball because she was wearing a jumpsuit.

Darcy Krueger headed to The Tampa Bay Homeschool Homecoming in Florida looking forward to a good night.

Her plans quickly derailed however when she was turned away at the door.

The reason given was that the 17-year-old was wearing a smart, dark blue jumpsuit rather than a dress.

"I was very surprised. I called my mom and I was telling my friends about it because I couldn't really believe it," Darcy told Honey.nine.

(Image: Facebook)

She found support in the form of her mum Melissa, who posed on Facebook to express how upset she was.

Darcy had actually gone to the shops with the intention of buying a dress.

The plan didn't come off however, because she could not find anything she liked.

She instead opted for a jumpsuit she already had in her wardrobe.

When asked by the online publication about the decision to bar Darcy, a spokesperson for the school said 390 students had bought tickets to the event but only one was blocked from entering.

They said the schoolgirl had been given the chance to return in a dress, which she had declined to do.

(Image: Facebook)

Despite the fact Darcy has had her ticket refunded, Melissa feels justice has not been done.

"This is my daughter's senior year and to see her get rejected and denied entrance to a dance that she could have went to any semi-formal event in the area and walked right in and no one would have batted an eye," she said

"She was dressed up and was appropriate so that's frustrating because this is like a memory now, you know."
description: Darcy Krueger was denied entry to The Tampa Bay Homeschool Homecoming in Florida
